alert.note: Alert for Le Flore (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Wind Chill Advisory issued January 14 at 1:40AM CST until January 16 at 6:00PM CST by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM CST TUESDAY... ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM NOON TODAY TO NOON CST MONDAY... ...WIND CHILL WATCH IS CANCELLED... * WHAT...Moderate to heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 1 to 4 inches. Very cold wind chills as low as 18 below zero. * WHERE...Portions of northwest and west central Arkansas and southeast Oklahoma. * WHEN...For the Winter Storm Warning, from noon today to noon CST Monday. For the Wind Chill Advisory, until 6 PM CST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous conditions could impact the Monday morning commute. The cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes.
info.instruction: Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. In Arkansas, for the latest road conditions call 1-800-245- 1672 or go to idrivearkansas.com. In Oklahoma, for the latest road conditions call 1-844-465-4997 or go to okRoads.org.
